ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about pollutants, particle size distributions, combustion-related pollution, and atmospheric chemistry.

Atmospheric chemistry, pollutant (e.g. tropospheric ozone, nitrogen oxides, particulate matter, primary and secondary organic aerosols, etc) formation and lifetime, pollutant removal pathways, measurement methods (devices and modeling programs).

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The homework in this class is difficult, but there are only 5 problem sets. The exams are pretty difficult as well. Homework was helpful for exam preparation. I did not enjoy the questions that simply required us to summarize long research papers. I feel like they took a long time, and I did not retain the information very well over the long term. I believe normal qualitative questions concerning those topics could be more helpful in narrowing down the most important takeaways from the papers.

Strengths: High correlation between lecture content and exams. Bi-weekly psets are incredibly manageable and non-cumulative exams + cheat sheets really reduce the stress level of the course. 
Weaknesses: The uncertainty with the exam dates was a little frustrating, especially with the second exam occurring during reading week. Cramming all the hard atmospheric chemistry at the very end was stressful. Lecture content does not always translate well to psets.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would only recommend this course to a student that is very interested in air quality and enjoys chemistry. The class is a graduate level class, so it covers an overwhelming amount of concepts.

I would only recommend this course to those who have an interest or at least some background knowledge in air pollution, as it is a graduate level course and the second semester of ENVE 373. Those without a background in air pollution could take ENVE 373.
